intro: Halenia pichinchensis, commonly known as the Pichincha halena, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four petals, and it produces small, dark blue berries. Halenia pichinchensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
